New Records: The New York Mets made history as the first team to clinch a postseason spot and win a playoff series in games where they faced a deficit in the ninth inning or later
Key Match Events: New York Mets trailed 2-0 in the top of the ninth inning before Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead three-run homer and Starling Marte added a single to make it 4-2
Francisco Lindor hit a two-run home run in another game to secure their playoff spot
Post-Match Reflections: The Milwaukee Brewers were eliminated in the wild card round for the second consecutive year, both times on their home field
The New York Mets' journey from a 24-35 season to making the playoffs showcased their late-season surge and October magic
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets had 13 wins over the Philadelphia Phillies during the regular season
